headline.main: GOING FAR OUT ON TELEVISION; Space Series Requires Extensive Research By Writers

results.snippet: STAGEHANDS sprinkled moon dust with shovels and labored to nudge craters into place. Young actors wriggled into space suits and adjusted helmets. A ringing telephone was cut off abruptly as a red light flashed to indicate that everything was ready...
results.lead_paragraph: STAGEHANDS sprinkled moon dust with shovels and labored to nudge craters into place. Young actors wriggled into space suits and adjusted helmets. A ringing telephone was cut off abruptly as a red light flashed to indicate that everything was ready for Ziv to effect a landing on its Hollywood moon for its "Men Into Space" series.

results.snippet: After 116 days of idleness the nation's steel mills were sending out their plume of smoke last week, and most of the 500,000 strikers were back on the Job under the terms of an eighty-day Taft-Hartley injunction. But the chances for an early...
results.lead_paragraph: After 116 days of idleness the nation's steel mills were sending out their plume of smoke last week, and most of the 500,000 strikers were back on the Job under the terms of an eighty-day Taft-Hartley injunction. But the chances for an early agreement between the United Steelworkers and the major producers an agreement that would preclude a resumption of the walkout when the injunction expires Jan. 26--appeared more wispy than the smoke.

headline.main: Could Put Man in Space Now, Russian Says; But Flight Will Wait Till Safety Is Sure, Scientist Asserts
